author: A_Brickset_user
title: PERFECT
review: This set is perfect for a small set. It comes with so much in one package. It has a snake, a gem, a map, a minifig, a nice piece of land, a spider, and a very rare golden medallion. Great set, i wish I havent lost my medallion...

author: Gus_263
title: Jungle Surprise
review: This is an useful small set of the adventurers theme, previously in the desert, this in the jungle subtheme. It have a good color scheme, with red, yellow and blue parts, with good quality in painting. Green parts like the plants are included to looks like jungle. Another itens to make a lego scenery are the spider and of course the shapes of the plants and of the minifigure. Things like the map, the minifigure's bag and hat makes this set likes with the other adventurers. The minifigure is a female one. Good to make cities because only male figures can't make one. The itens makes this minifigure an adventurer, and the complete set too. A red snake is also included and is well made to sets like this. The playability is basically play with the spider, snake and the minifigure in this building, but with more others is easy make creations or transforms it in a bigger set. The size is small, but the pieces are useful, to sets with these colors or not.

author: hustla187
title: Welcome to the Jungle
review: If you owned any of the Amazon sets, this is a great one to pick up. There are alot of supplies in this set like guns, treasures, and a small temple. The Gail Storm minifigure is also a great part of this set too. Overall, this set is pretty good.

author: asianlego
title: Dangerous Situation in a Jungle
review:
Pippin Reed is back in another small set dedicated to her. She is afronted with an altar with a strange color scheme and two deadly animals. (Spider, Snake) There are lots of leaf pieces to bring on the jungle ambience. Pippin Reed carries a rucksack, treasure map and a rifle as well as a white explorer hat. The altar top swivels to reveal a treasure inside which is a golden plate with a monkey face on it. (Or at least I think its a monkey). One of the more complete Adventurers impulse sets.

-asianlego

author: kipper147
title: grade school fun
review: I remember picking this set up when i was in kindergarden :P  my mom was subbing at my school (where i only had to go for the beggining half of the day) and my mom was subbing in art class. we picked this up at the gas staion on the way to school, and i remember building it in the teachers lounge :P  amazing set....although i dont remember ever seeing the gold part afterwards :/

author: JSB23
title: Quick while they're not looking steal the good plates!
review:
I always thought the adventurer line was cool but for one reason or another I never got any of the sets except this one.

Figures
Gail storm- It's a good figure but I never really liked it. 4/5

Accesories
A map, jewel, backpack, and a rifle in a $3 set? Awesome! 5/5  

Build
At age 5 at found the build to be short yet rather difficult great for an impulse set 4/5

Playability
This is one of the few $5 and under sets that stands on it own as far as this goes, with a snake and a spider to "fight" and fact that the shine opens make this way above aver age 5/5

Overall
A great set not worth more then $5 ($10 if your a huge fan) but I can't complain 
5/5

author: f_man
title: A good set, just small
review:
For me it's hard to make anything out of these small sets. Sure, they're great for younger kids but overall the best of them are only parts packs.
I got this set as a present, I believe. But I can't remember for what or why.

Pros

  • The minifigure and the backpack are nice
  • I love the golden piece.

Cons

  • The size is only good as impulse.
  • The architecture is rather lacking, but what can you say?

author: Cake_Crafted
title: Great set for the size
review:
I don't actually own this set, however I was able to almost completely build it thanks to the handy website that is rebrickable.com.

Getting on to the review, you get one minifigure, Pippin Reed also known as Gail Storm or whatever you want to call her. She has a nice map piece along with a rifle and backpack which can be opened up, although this makes it quite big and hard to stand the figure up when not on studs.

Moving on the model itself, it is very small so not much to cover. You can open the whole thing up to reveal the treasure hidden inside, a shiny gold plate which looks pretty cool. There is also a small gem attached beneath the leaf and a area where the snake can hide in.

So to conclude this is a pretty nice set for the size, definitely my favorite of the small sets from the Jungle subtheme. The only complaint I have is on the back it would be nice to have something to fill the small gaps under the lid, but that's all.

A nice set, but I have seen this go for quite a lot of money on eBay so don't pay too much for it

Rating 4/5

author: Gameaucracy
title: Jungle Surprise, Kiss the Snake You Fool
review:
Alright, what's next on the list? Ah, Jungle Surprise, a classic...ish. Lot's of nice little pieces and my first female minifig! I'm moving up in the world. I think at this point in my life I was young enough to go "Mortgage payments, what's that? Sounds terrible."

So here we have a nice little adventurer that goes by the name of...name of...*google search* Gail Storm? Really? Ok then. Nice little adventurer by the name of Gail Storm. Ah yes, knew that name like the back of my hand. On the box you see her holding some treasure, which from the looks of it seems to be one of those fancy gold iPads that people get when they have more money than sense. And in the other hand she has her trusty rifle, because she is a strong independent woman that doesn't need no man's protection; I'm assuming from people trying to steal her iPad. Also on the box you see her looking at the snake, who's going in for the kiss. The snake's going "I've only had two drinks I'm fine" while Ms. Storm is going "I just want to be friends" all over that sucker.

There are some other nice pieces on this set too. A spider is provided that doubles as something you can put on your mother's pillow to scare her to...I mean I wouldn't know what else you could use it for. There's also a map and a diamond, as well as some foliage to add to some other stuff you got going on.

Overall a nice little addition to go along with other adventure sets you got. Or if you just want some treasure and animals, I guess that's fine too...

Score: One slip of the tongue out of a last night's regret. Yeah that sounds about right.
